website_summaries.verdict: Fast, precise cutting through hardwood, plywood and sheetrock had users crowing over this oscillating multi-tool. Keyless blade change is a nice plus, as is the wider oscillation range setting between 3.4° and 5°.
pros: Users like the higher cutting radius, which ranges up to 5°, as well as variable speed and overall power under load that this 4.2A tool provides
Quick blade changes with no allen wrench needed, and accepts “just about any” type of blade
User can change blade angles, too
cons: Depth and cutting guide not included
LED light doesn’t provide enough illumination
A few reports of blade loosening during use

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. Easy to load blades, performs as advertised. Cuts straight and very easy to use. Blades wear quickly, but this is exactly what I would expect. This is a specialty tool and should be used for cuts you cannot do with other tools. This unit has the largest motor, and once you use it, you can see that it doesn't load, doesn't get hot, and has great balance.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: INOPERABLE LATCH ON CASE, AND NO RESOLUTION
customer_reviews.text: UPON RECIEPT ONE OF THE LATCHES ON THE CASE WAS UNLATCHED . WHEN WE TRIED TO LATCH IT, IT WOULD NOT LOCK, THEREBY MAKING THE CASE POSSIBLY TO OPEN AND THE TOOL FALL OUT . WHEN WE CONTACTED ROCKWELL AT THE CUSTOMER SERVICE NUMBER LISTED ON THE UNOPENED PACKING I WAS TOLD THAT THE THREE YEAR WARANTEE WAS ON THE TOOL AND NOT ON THE CASE . I ASKED IF THEY CAN REPLACE THE DEFECTIVE CASE WITH THE BAD LATCH, HE SAID NO!! SO WHAT DO WE DO NOW?
customer_reviews.author: DEL

customer_reviews.title: Impressive tool.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is powerful. I actually carved a recess in brick, ( it was old soft brick, but still that's pretty impressive), for a deep outlet in a baseboard. This thing didn't even flinch. You just need to use the right blade and you are good to go. I went thru two Bosch battery powered oscillating tools. One still works and I will use it if it's convenient to not have a cord, but it is no match for the sheer power of this Rockwell tool. Impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: From  one who owned a RK510 Sonicrafter.
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old RK510 has seen better days. Last used to remove grout, the motor speed is not constant. Fast forward to this new version which is superior IMO. No more issues with the chuck (blade) coming loose, which requires regular wrenching with a hex key. No more lost hex keys, its not needed. The supplied blade seems more robust, it did not dull while accidentally cutting through a nail. I like the carry case, compared to the black fabric bag supplied with the RK510. The blades on the bottom were camouflaged, had to dump the contents to know what was in the bag. This Sonicrafter is a winner in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: My favorite
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a tool. I had the original sonic crafter. I wore it out after many years of use. I tried another brand for price reasons and it was deficient for a number of reasons. The main reason for the switch back to sonic crafter was the teeth that held the blades started to break off in less than two years. I came back to this model a month ago and I am very pleased. I can't imagine that any other brand is better than this model at this price point. Long cord, variable speeds, powerful, and a top notch grip system to hold the blades.
customer_reviews.author: citi

customer_reviews.title: Rockwell RK5151K 4.2 Amp Sonicrafter F80...versatile tool. Super highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this tool for 6 months now while working to bring a house I bought up to snuff. I have cut wood, steel, plastic, drywall, PVC, brick and probably something else. I have sanded several things with several different grits. When you need a tool for a special job and you realize this is the only tool that will do it right, you have a versatile tool. Super highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg W. Whitmer

customer_reviews.title: Tool every handyman needs
customer_reviews.text: This is the tool you go to to make a cut that nothing else can. It has both a selectable speed and a selectable amp. It comes with a variety of cutting implements. This tool will cut just about anything with the right blade. It has an easy blade change system. Also comes with a nice tool box to carry everything in.
customer_reviews.author: Darren W. Lewandowski

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this multi tool!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this new Rockwell for 2 months and love it. I previously had 2 Genesis brand multi tools and had good luck with them, till the switches went out of both of them. I started searching for a better brand and landed on this Rockwell at a great sale price. Has more power than you need. The blade clamp tightener took a little getting used to, but I like the tool very well. Heavily built, the sign of a quality tool.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Taylor

customer_reviews.title: A Time Saver
customer_reviews.text: I have had my machine for the past five months, and can only say that I am getting my money's worth out of it. It shortened my bathroom tub tile project by at least a month had I continued working by hand. Like any machine, you will have to use common sense while using it. If the machine is getting too hot, turn it off and let it cool down.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Caution on the 3-year warranty
customer_reviews.text: The 3-Year warranty on this tool sounds great but it is conditional upon completing the online warranty registration within 30 days of purchase. I ordered one in September, 2019 and it worked so well that I ordered a second one in October, 2019 for sheetrock repairs. In March, 2020 the first one broke, (sounds like a gear in the head broke) and in May, 2020 the same thing happened to the second one. And before you ask, No; I did not fill out the online registration. I guess I will just stick with Milwaukee. Ending on a positive note, when it was working it was great. I liked everything about it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott F.

customer_reviews.title: Simply, the best
customer_reviews.text: First off, I have learned my lesson regarding cordless hand power tools. The idea seems great, but the very expensive back-up batteries don’t last long enough and they tend to leave you high and dry mid-project. If plug in power isn’t available use batteries, if it is stay away from the batteries stick with plug-in. The Rockwell is the toughest, finest multi tool made. I’m de-tiling 2 baths, and a laundry room with the Rockwell, it’s doing fine. I’m sure I’ll find 1000 new uses once a really get used to the tool’s capabilities. I’m happy I bought the best model, it’s easy to use while being a rugged tool.
customer_reviews.author: LighteningLou

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: There are zero instructions in English except for the usual 3mpages of saftey stuff. I could not even put an attachment on it. It was supposed to have a tumb size sanding attachment with it, it didn’t . Completely useless. They appears to be a screw that needs to come off to put the pin in that hold the attachments, I couldn’t get it off, no way. And the attachment doesn’t appear that it would fit even if I could. I never got so far as to turn the thing on. Forget this. Is Bosch has a thumb sander this goes In the trash
customer_reviews.author: pacatam

customer_reviews.title: Time saving tool
customer_reviews.text: This thing is SWEET! I build for a living and this has taken place of my reciprocating saw in tight places. I've seen it in action but hadn't bit the bullet. I'm glad I did as it is a great time saver. I ordered extra blades but after receiving the kit I realized that it comes with a pretty good starter set.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Top Choice
customer_reviews.text: If you need a tool like this for a multitude of reasons, it should be your first choice. I had used one in the past, but now I own one. My first use was cutting off door frames to install hardwood flooring. Simple, fast, easy & accurate!
customer_reviews.author: Bookend Philly

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool to have
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because of the good reviews and value compared to some of the other name brand ones. I knew I wouldn't be using it a lot so decided to got with this one. I've used it several times now for cutting off screws that I couldn't get off when replacing my deck boards. It works well but I find I need to really tighten down the blade so that it doesn't move on me over time. They don't just lock in like the saws all blades do on that tool. But for the occasional times I will use it I think it is all I need.
customer_reviews.author: W. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: light years ahead of my harbor freight tool
customer_reviews.text: graduated to a real cut off tool. this thing is awesome . easy to change blades . more than enough power . cuts through nails and 2x4's like buttah. this tool has a variable angle setting for more aggressive cutting but works just fine on default setting. also has a case included and about 50 bucks worth of free blades.
customer_reviews.author: CHad

customer_reviews.title: Failed on this second usage
customer_reviews.text: This product has plenty of power. I bought it to use on a shower grout removal job. While running on high on the second day, it suddenly started screaming louder and vibrating more. It felt like something came loose inside. The switch between the two angle settings did not latch positively in each position. Not happy with this product. I had to finish the project, so I went out and bought a Dremel, which had much less vibration when comparing to the Rockwell at normal operating use. So far so good with the Dremel.
customer_reviews.author: Brian R.

customer_reviews.title: Best tool ever
customer_reviews.text: Love this tool. I am not sure how I made it without it in the past 20 years. I already used it to cut drywall, trimmed the door molding to fit the new wood floor, cut a piece of splintered door frame out to replace that piece. I read a lot of reviews about the locking mechanism not being snap on, but I have not issues spending another 5 seconds on tightening the blades. I preferred that tool over the Bosch, since it uses any regular oszillating blade. The one thing I would improve is the LED work light. It really does not light up enough to be helpful.
customer_reviews.author: T. Bohm

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, as good as the Big Boys
customer_reviews.text: I blew out my Porter-Cable Multi-tool; I bought this Multi-tool years ago, tops at the time. My preferred tools are DeWalt and Makita, but expensive. Did my homework. Visited most Tool Reviews conducted by people/pros who know and use tools daily. Found that the Rockwell 5151 rated 3rd or 4th just behind Dewalt and Makita. For half the price. Been using it on several projects and have not found it lacking. It performs as well or better than my old Porter-Cable.
customer_reviews.author: Manhattan Beach

customer_reviews.title: I really like the Rockwell 4
customer_reviews.text: I really like the Rockwell 4.2 Amp. F80. It has variable speed and also works well in the lower speeds. I've used it quite a bit and I really appreciate the quick blade changes without needing a special wrench. The case is nice and I am really satisfied with how it handles. The only reason why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 was that the light is really weak. I feel like if you are going to engineer a light into the design of the tool then it should light up your work but not the case with this tool. After using this tool I still would purchase it again because I do like the way it performs.
customer_reviews.author: deep

customer_reviews.title: No surprise this is a top rated tool in it's category
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the performance and versatility of this tool. Once you start using it, you'll realize how helpful it's going to be for dealing with chores that we're more difficult in the past. Carry case is well made and great from carrying the additional blades you'll no doubt add over time.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph L. Penza

customer_reviews.title: Lots of uses
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this now for a year and it is a solid tool. I use it while restoring boats and it has made my life so much easier. Depending on the blade, it can cut wood, metal, fiberglass, all while maintaining control of it. It's easy for me to use one handed, while I'm holding a vacuum hose in the other hand to keep the dust down while cutting fiberglass. I can't believe how easy this has made my work and is the most versatile tool in my collection.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should have one of these!!
customer_reviews.text: Love my new Rockwell Sonicrafter F80. It's very versatile and quite powerful. I had another brand for the past year and this one is so much better than the other one I had. My friend had a gate that dragged on the cement as it opened. It took me all of 30 seconds to trim off the bottom of the gate and repair the problem. I also had a piece of copper pipe that had to be cut. I was amazed at how fast and easily I was able to cut it. I'm very happy with my new 'best tool'. Thank You Denis Nething
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: If you don't have this saw you need it. I bought this saw over a year ago just have in my tool box, but it has quickly become my go to saw for anything requiring a straight cut. This saw can handle cutting tile, or cutting wood, nothing stops it. I really like the easy to control depth setting of the blade and the laser guide. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Jsatterf

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: This is a very handy saw. I needed it to flush-cut trim on my house so I could replace it and I was amazed at how well it works. The tool-less blade change and variable speed works well. It is a quality tool and I highly recommend it. Update: This saw is awesome. It is amazing how handy this saw has become. I have used it for a lot of different jobs. It should be in everyone's shop. It is a solid 5 star!
customer_reviews.author: CCSherri

customer_reviews.title: This tool is kind of like a Dremel tool meets a Sawzal
customer_reviews.text: This tool is kind of like a Dremel tool meets a Sawzal. It is great for cutting in very tight areas were you really don’t wanna make a mess. I used this tool to replace one piece of siding on the side of my house without cutting into the other surrounding boards. This tool is quite versatile with their different types of blades it comes with. If you don’t think you need this to buy one and use it then you’ll wonder how you did with out It.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald A. Leighton

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite tool
customer_reviews.text: I have a flush cut tool from Harbor Freight, but I can only run it for about 30 seconds before it makes my hand numb. My buddy has a nice Dremel that I used to remove all my deck boards. This Rockwell blows away the Dremel. It has two levels of aggressiveness, in most cases the low setting works great. I had to use the high setting to cut a hardened screw. Great tool that goes in my primary tool bag and a bargain at under $100. Hint: buy carbide blades.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations
customer_reviews.text: So far this has exceeded my expectations. I bought it to cut the bottom of my base cabinets to lay my floating floor. It worked as expected, but I also had an exposed beam and the sanding attachment saved me from using a bunch of elbow grease trying to scrub the paint and other products from my remodel. It looks amazing and I’ve been able to use it for other random house projects. No issues at all. It was worth buying. I haven’t had the issues that others seem to have had.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: ROCKWELL IS THE BEST.
customer_reviews.text: I have eight Rockwell products. Two 4 1/2" Circular Saws, One Impact Gun and Four Oscillator tools. Rockwell goes to the top of my list for reliability, durability and ease of use. Furthermore, Rockwell stands behind every tool with a wonderful warranty program which I've had the opportunity to experience. Highly recommend any and all Rockwell tools.
customer_reviews.author: Carnagie Thornhill

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Tool-free "blade" changes in seconds. Powerfully and precise, compact and comfortable. My girlfriend needed one for a project at her house and I saw this on Amazon and convinced her to get it saying I would reimburse her and give her my HF version if she didn't see the value. It arrived quickly and she/we tried both--I then immediately bought one as Christmas present for my dad and would have gotten one for myself except I knew my GF was already taking care of that. ;-)
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Easier, quicker, more accurate, and quieter than expected
customer_reviews.text: This well-made oscillating saw - my second Rockwell - has become a go-to power tool. Instead of always using a handsaw or hacksaw, I've used it renovating 1-1/4in shelving stiles, notching 1/16in aluminum angles, cutting 5/16in steel all-thread, even trimming Fiberglas printed circuit boards. (Is there a metal grinding blade?) Easier to hand-hold, more accurate, quicker, and quieter than I expected. Just as effective but no longer as scary as the oscillating saw my orthopedic doctor used to cut my pastor leg casts off when I was a kid! If you use it safely and wear glasses, then I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: R Miller

customer_reviews.title: Best Thing Since Sliced Bread!
customer_reviews.text: I never knew such a thing existed and was unsure how useful it would be. Now I wish that I had one 20 years ago (if they even existed then). Scraping paint. Cutouts when drywalling. Cutting pipe. Installing door latch. Cutting trim. With the right blade, it allows you to accomplish things in minutes, that would have taken hours to do badly without the tool. Spend the money and buy decent quality like this one. I think that an inexpensive model might be terrible to use.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Libby

customer_reviews.title: Works very well. The light is much more helpful ...
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. The light is much more helpful than I expected. I have used this for cutting base boards, door trim, and dry wall now for different projects and it is definitely worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Neat tool but takes time to be proficient
customer_reviews.text: I had a door jamb that required cutting out the rotted area on the bottom. This was the first time I used the tool. It takes a little time to master control. My cut was not as perfect as I would have liked but thankfully it was to be covered with aluminum trim. I like the tool and I can see a lot of uses for it in the future. You just have to go slow until you get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I can only wish I had found this sooner. I had a Craftsman for 5 years and this Rockwell put it to shame. It's easy to use and will cut through anything like butter. It's awesome and the case just tops it off.
customer_reviews.author: MStuntz

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to any power tool collection
customer_reviews.text: The Rockwell F-80 is a rockin' good oscillating multi tool. The LED light is great and after owning the F-30 and F-50, this is by far the best one yet...I use these for under-cutting door casing and trim for tile flooring and back splashes, cutting wire chases in drywall, plaster, and box cutouts in cabinetry and walls...Great tool... Arnie's Home Improvements
customer_reviews.author: Greg A.

customer_reviews.title: Flexible Tool
customer_reviews.text: Very controllable - found it perfect for grout removal on lowest speed and lowest oscillation. Does transmit a bit of vibration - after an hour I had a bit of tingling up my arm but compared to the agony that an hour of grout sawing would give me - bring it on anytime! Not used it for anything other than grout removal so far. No complaints though - looking like an excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Burton

customer_reviews.title: Seems Pretty Nice
customer_reviews.text: I'd never used one of these oscillating multitools before getting this one, so I have nothing to compare it to. It seems like a well-made tool and it's doing what I want it to. This type of tool is a great innovation. Whether this one ends up being "the one" or not I'll always have one in my kit from now on.
customer_reviews.author: amphibiac

customer_reviews.title: Great for precision work.
customer_reviews.text: This tool definitely outperforms my old harbor freight multi tool. It’s good to have the variable speed. I used it for detail cutting for drywall and on cabinet installation in a tight space with lots of odd angles and corners. It works well for detail jobs where precision is needed.
customer_reviews.author: amzn111

customer_reviews.title: Best Oscillating tool I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tool to cut out a 1/2" piece of plywood in the cabin of my boat. I had previously attempted the project with a battery powered oscillating tool that would have taken forever and a Dremel Ultra Saw (see review) that worked great but just couldn't get into all of the tight places. I bought this tool because of its' 5 deg. oscillation setting. It cut through the plywood like butter.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and way more versatile than single speed single arc tools.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and way more versatile than single speed single arc tools. The quick change is very nice and doesn't work loose the way older Allen bolt tool holders. The dual arc feature works really well for dealing with different materials. The wide speed range also helps it's versatility and lets you match the speed to what you are cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara McCray

customer_reviews.title: Awesome versatile tool.  Durable and not very loud.  Love it!
customer_reviews.text: One of my new favorite tools. Remodeling our kitchen and have already used it for a number of different purposes. Well built and durable. I will be buying one of these for each of my adult children who like to do DIY jobs around their houses. Love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: BigNetShopper

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile cutoff saw
customer_reviews.text: This cutoff saw is extremely versatile and well made. I’ve used it to cut out switch boxes in drywall, take up stuck glued down tile, cut off window seats and trim wood around door jams. Works well and has plenty of power. Don’t cheap out on blades though as this is an important part of the saws ability to get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: R. Grau

customer_reviews.title: Awesome machine, great great great...  Love this tool and so will you.. Don't go cheap. go for something that will last years
customer_reviews.text: Awesome is all I can say. This thing is a work horse and just keeps on going. I have use it to build a roof, walls, floors, repair walls, do some project work and more. It just works and I cannot stress enough how well it does that. I am thrilled thta I chose to get this over the other two they make (both which are good as well). So far it has not found anything to stop it.
customer_reviews.author: DWM

customer_reviews.title: Simply amazing tool!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing tool! I wish I had gotten one a long time ago. Makes more noise than I expected and the light is pretty much useless but boy does it cut thru material with ease. Changing blades is super easy with no tools required. It will, and already has made my DIY projects much easier. I promise, this tool will not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had purchase many of his kind, but none of them had given me the results that Rockwell oscillating multi-tool done, very easy to use no need for special key to change the blade or any attachments, does not come loose with use, i recommend it,
customer_reviews.author: Celia Argabright

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful.
customer_reviews.text: I liked it so well I gifted one. Very nice and powerful. My dislike was a month later big box store locally was selling exact same tool for $50.00 cheaper. I almost returned them but I considered the value I received on other purchases and took a hit for the team. Still works like new and I got over the price disappointment. I'm happy overall.
customer_reviews.author: gotthis

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one to replace one that was stolen on a job site. Every thing is the same as the earlier model except the pin/screw that secures the blade in place is shorter and you have to make sure everything is aligned before you can get the threads to engage.
customer_reviews.author: Dnewt

customer_reviews.title: Only good on cutting wood... eats up $20 metal blades when trying to cut nails or screws...
customer_reviews.text: Only good at plunge cutting wood... it eats up $20 metal blades when trying to cut nails or screws... instructions on tool use are dismal...
customer_reviews.author: JakRaft

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, subpar case
customer_reviews.text: Happy with this purchase in every way except the case lid. Read other reviews and thought it wasn't a big deal, but yeah, it's actually pretty annoying. Don't always review but this was a top notch choice.
customer_reviews.author: P Family

customer_reviews.title: Super handy tool.
customer_reviews.text: I have lots of construction tools but this is one of most versatile and handy. It is well designed and has lots of power. The build in work light isn't worth squat but it's not a flashlight. Absolutely love this tool!
customer_reviews.author: J Moyer

customer_reviews.title: Great power and versatility
customer_reviews.text: It's a multi-tool...the possibilities are endless. This is well-built, durable (so far), and very powerful. The big box stores sell the "lower" models of this for the same price. Why buy those when you can get the top-tier for a better price here on Amazon?! No-brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: I want another one
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I wanna business and didn’t realize how such a great parent could affect efficiency of a job that you were using this tool with. By this tool it’s reliable fully adjustable at every new angle, quick disconnect and pretty much all attachments out there work with this tool. I want another one
customer_reviews.author: Brute

customer_reviews.title: Really versatile and useful.
customer_reviews.text: What a great tool. We have used it in so many ways just in a few weeks during our bathroom remodel that it has paid for itself over and over. We would recommend having one to any do it yourselfer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... job yet but I have used the tool works great. Had to make a plunge cut on something ...
customer_reviews.text: Actually bought this for removing tile I haven't started that job yet but I have used the tool works great. Had to make a plunge cut on something it worked perfect couldn't have done it without this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Powered Tool
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best power tool I have ever bought! More versatile than a sawsall, great when removing and installing pre-hung doors.
customer_reviews.author: I. Diaz

customer_reviews.title: It get some getting use to...but good tool to have
customer_reviews.text: I tried it out cutting carpet. Works great til the scraper tip dulls. Then it start to make you work. Razor blades...cut and done, no plug in and set up. Now for grout removal....OOhhh Yeahhhh !! I have some projects I want to try in the very near future and Im looking forward to using it. I like it. Merry xmas to me...
customer_reviews.author: Emani2

customer_reviews.title: If you think a tool like this something you can use I say “this tool is great”
customer_reviews.text: Smooth to operate easy blade change. This thing saves time and gets into hard to get into places. I’m blown away and happy I chose this model because it has power to do the job. Short learning curve.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Hot knife thru butter
customer_reviews.text: I used this to cut directly into my base board to instl vanities in my bathrooms. Works fantastic. First time ever using one and these and was incredibly simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: Elmer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool to have in your arsenal
customer_reviews.text: Bought tool after using it over a weekend on a project. The tool we used was 9 years old and going strong. This is just awesome and versatile. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JTown Johnny mom

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I've had an off brand "Multi-tool" for years and finally decided to get a "real" one. The Rockwell Sonicrafter is in a completely different league. I wish I had bought one a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: Glen

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like no saw you ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. Feels like I'm in the future cutting a hole with a light saber! Just cuts right through things with no effort! At weird angles, it just plunges in!
customer_reviews.author: Power User

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. Love how it works on old construction of plaster and lathe. If you can't figure out how to use the blade lock after a time or two.... you might not like it but I think it's awesome for the money !!
customer_reviews.author: Keith B.

customer_reviews.title: So far I really do like this model and the extra power it provides is ...
customer_reviews.text: This being my 2nd Rockwell tool the first worked very well but did not last as long as I’d hoped.I decided to update to,a more powerful model.So far I really do like this model and the extra power it provides is very noticeable. Well made carrying case easily stores tool and a very long power cord which I feel is also Important to have.
customer_reviews.author: alanwiseman

customer_reviews.title: I have tried many... and this is the best
customer_reviews.text: For anyone who has never used one of these tools... they are a must have! I have trialed several models before finally settling down on this one. Please do your homework and don’t be suckered in to a lesser model.... this tool works as it should.... and that is saying a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kallaway

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tool
customer_reviews.text: I've Had it a year. Remodeled 2 bedrooms into one room. Couldn't believe how many things I could use it for. Dry wall removal and install, cutting trim, cutting out old 2x6's, cutting nails, sanding, electrical holes, etc. Never missed a beat, very quiet compared to very loud porter cable I had before that I returned as bearing was going out in after a few days of use. easy to change blades. Easy to make a very precise cut. Great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Janssen

customer_reviews.title: very nice tool, works much smoother /better then the $39 ...
customer_reviews.text: very nice tool, works much smoother /better then the $39 cheap one I bought locally , and the quick change blade system keeps my blood pressure in check. real easy after getting use to it. the carry case is marginal for room , might buy tool box for it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hall

customer_reviews.title: great product t
customer_reviews.text: This tool is one of the coolest tools I own.Gets in close and cuts like butter.Great for cutting door jams outlet boxes sanding it can do just about anything and you can change out cutters easily.And if you have an issue Rockwell is a great co to deal with. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: bryan

customer_reviews.title: Love it. I had a Harbor Freight el-cheapo $19 ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I had a Harbor Freight el-cheapo $19 oscillating saw that worked great, but was loud and lasted only 6 months. Pros: Great cord length, pretty quiet for an oscillating saw, low vibration, tool free blade change and accessories. Cons: Only that I wish the tool-case was hinged.
customer_reviews.author: J. deBe

customer_reviews.title: Love this too
customer_reviews.text: This Rockwell toll has worked flawlessly with everything I've thrown at it from construction use to sanding. A must tool for every person doing home, auto and whatever work is thrown at it. Just use good quality blades in it
customer_reviews.author: Woodturner Smith

customer_reviews.title: Rockwell RK5151K 4.2 Amp Sonicrafter F80
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this to scrape peeling paint, cut out exterior window trim and sanding small areas. I like the weight and the easiness of changing accessories. It provides a nice clean cut in tight spaces.
customer_reviews.author: G. A. Dentner

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Made it through concrete board without issue but had to purchase different blade. Recommend the manufacturer include more different blade types in the base kit.
customer_reviews.author: WhiteLight

customer_reviews.title: This tool is powerful, yet small enough to not ...
customer_reviews.text: This tool is powerful, yet small enough to not get in the way while working. There is some vibration with the tool but it worked perfectly for removing door facings and things of that nature.
customer_reviews.author: Nana2boys

customer_reviews.title: Be careful, the box somehow allowed rainwater in.
customer_reviews.text: I left it in the back of my truck and it got wet despite being in the box under a tonneau cover. I dried it off and applied some Boeshield T-9 and it worked fine. It seems to be a quality tool. The dust collector (optional) is sub-optimal though.
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: duotech switch broke
customer_reviews.text: After a month of use the wood/metal switch got stuck onto metal mode; when it finally physically was able to switch back to wood it still stayed on metal mode internally. So now I have an obnoxiously loud tool whenever I cut wood (99% of my work)
customer_reviews.author: Brewster

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: I have had a chance to really put this tool through it's paces. I have used it for several work projects and it has been such a blessing. I don't know why I didn't try it sooner and honestly thinking of getting another to keep around the house. I have removed window frames with it cut bolts, cuts through pipes easily. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool, used for cutting base board on flooring ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice tool, used for cutting base board on flooring install. Tool was bigger and heavier then I thought it would be, but still easy to work with. Can find many reasons to use this tool. Well made.
customer_reviews.author: WAYNE W.

customer_reviews.title: Oscillating Multi-Tool
customer_reviews.text: Directions for use are very poorly written. ONCE we figured out how to get this to work, unit works very well!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: A must have and must buy
customer_reviews.text: Cannot emphasize the amount of money, time, and work this little tool has saved me during a full house remodel. Should be in every homeowners toolbox. Stronger motor and dual °s for better cutting control.
customer_reviews.author: Santa

customer_reviews.title: Paid for itself many times
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool and found more uses for it than I would ever have imagined. It allowed me to do things in moments that would have taken forever or been impossible otherwise. It lasted through two home remodel projects before it burned up, and i replaced it immediately. Best tool i ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ITS A TANK !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome machine. Use it daily. Built like a tank. Now let’s find someone that can make the blades that can take a beating like this thing.
customer_reviews.author: chavel

customer_reviews.title: Best tool ever
customer_reviews.text: I should have purchased one of these years ago....amazing addition to my tool collection. Used it to trim door casings for tile installation recently and for molding as well. Cut tile like butter. Can't wait to try it on other tasks.
customer_reviews.author: MW from FLA

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Much better than the Dremel brand I had before this one. Wish the quick change was a little easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Muenster

customer_reviews.title: Best there is.
customer_reviews.text: Versatile and powerful. Great machine and Amazon has the best deals.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool
customer_reviews.text: Locking mechanism could be improved to quick clamp style like other yellow handled brands, but overall happy with purchase. Quiet and vibration isn’t bad.
customer_reviews.author: WhiskeyPirate

customer_reviews.title: Won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic!!! Loved the spin lock! Read lots of reviews and this will not disappoint!
customer_reviews.author: Chriscraftgal

customer_reviews.title: So far it has worked out great but the blades provided get ruined rather quickly on ...
customer_reviews.text: So far it has worked out great but the blades provided get ruined rather quickly on nails. I really like the quick change feature which makes blade changes fast and secure.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Wilfong

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Very handy tool. Only one I have ever owned so it's hard for me to compare to others but I have used in many times for many different situations in the short time I have owned it.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Kraushaar

customer_reviews.title: Lots of power, started to get warm after continuous running.
customer_reviews.text: Used to cut long outdoor siding. Started to get hot, continuous running for about 30 ft. Not too hot to hold, but thought I'd mention it. Powerful and has the blades to do just about anything. I did get the scraper separately. Haven't used it much but seems to be solid.
customer_reviews.author: BobJean1

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! does everything I wanted and more.
customer_reviews.text: learned of this tool when a friend helped me work on the interior of our barndo. What a versatile tool! He had one and when I saw the things it could do I was sold on it. I purchased one and has been just the thing for removing carpet tack strip and cutting for trim around doors. If you don't have one get one you won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: False advertisement
customer_reviews.text: The seller describes the product as Sonicrafter F80 4.2 amp tool. What is actually sent is the Sonicrafter F50 4.0 amp. I returned product 2 times and received the same product all 3 times. I kept the product on the 3rd time...cause I needed it. Don’t be fooled by the false advertising!
customer_reviews.author: C. Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: great service by Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Mine burned out on the 1st job, but Amazon had me a new one in 2 days. Bravo. I still think they are great products and would not hesitate buying again.
customer_reviews.author: trips

customer_reviews.title: Great product great price
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice tool. You can do a lot of things with this tool.
customer_reviews.author: pap

customer_reviews.title: Wow what a great deal, i love it way better then my ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow what a great deal, i love it way better then my cordless craftmans, rockwell did a nice job. Menards sells it for 129 on sale with no attachments. Handles very nice well balanced. I should have purchased 2 .
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: My 1st oscillating tool and I love it.
customer_reviews.text: Cuts so quickly. For 1st time users make a trial cut 1st because it cuts more quickly than you would expect. After that - easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kent Crawford

customer_reviews.title: The best I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: As home re modelers we use it every day, constantly finding new uses for it.
customer_reviews.author: Rick B

customer_reviews.title: I like this better than the Fein tool i used for many years.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Easy to use, lots of power, seems well made.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L Klick

customer_reviews.title: Cuts, shears, saws, sands...if inly it could make good BBQ, it would be the best tool in the world!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I'd had a tool like this year's ago! I'm currently renovating a 102 year old house and so far this tool has helped in so many ways: small, tight cuts, cutting out outlet holes in sheetrock, sanding, etc. It has saved the day more than once. And, because it can use universal attachments, I'm not as limited on which attachments I can buy and use.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Brumfield

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied in WV.
customer_reviews.text: This is the very best deal I ever made on an internet buy! The multitool is all around great! Rockwell is a quality product. I use it all the time. Thank You Very Much. Gary
customer_reviews.author: Gary in WV

customer_reviews.title: Not working anymore
customer_reviews.text: I barely used it, after not eve 3 months stopped working!!!!
customer_reviews.author: antonella

product_meta.title: Rockwell RK5151K 4.2 Amp Sonicrafter F80 Oscillating Multi-Tool with Duotech Oscillation Angle Technology. 12 Piece Kit includes 10 Accessories, Carrying Bag, and Oscillating Tool
product_meta.description: Style:Oscillating KitThe new Rockwell Duotech Oscillation Sonicrafter F80 is the first oscillating multi-tool that provides a choice of two oscillating angles: 5.0 o and 3.4 o. Users can choose the 5.0 o oscillating angle when projects require fast, aggressive cuts and quicker results, or the 3.4o angle for precision and continuous control. The versatile F80 works harder and faster than any other multi-tool, while enabling the user to choose the oscillating angle that best suits the job at hand. The handcrafted F80 can be used at a 5.0o oscillating angle with an end-cut blade to make short work of cross-cutting, ripping or making plunge-cuts in wood. Trim doorjambs or cut PVC. Then switch to the 3.4o angle to clip nail heads or cut metal pipe. Or using a rigid scraper blade, remove blistered paint, take rust from bare metal for priming or scrape and remove hardened caulk or adhesives. Clamp on a carbide grit semicircular blade to grind old grout from between floor or wall tiles. The cutting speed of the handcrafted F80 is five times faster than the basic Sonicrafter F50 (RK5121K). The F80, with an industry-leading maximum cutting load of 35 lbs. of force, can be pushed harder than any other multi-tool without stalling the blade.
feature_bullets: Duotech oscillation technology lets you select the optimum oscillation angle for power and precision
Variable speed dial for precision control – from 10,000 to 19,000 oscillations per minute
Powerful 4.2 Amp motor delivers constant speed and won’t stall under heavy loads
Hyperlock tool-free blade change system provides 1 ton of clamping force – prevents slipping during use, no matter the blade angle
Universal Fit System accepts all major brands of blades, sanders, and other accessories

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars648 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
